00001 #include <num.h>
00002 
00003 #define NUM_VERIFY      1
00004 #define DEBUG_LP        504065
00005 //#define DEBUG_LP      15617
00006 
00007 void
00008 num_file_start(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, unsigned int size, tw_lp * lp)
00009 {
00010 #if NUM_VERIFY
00011         if(lp->id == DEBUG_LP)
00012                 printf("%lld T%d %s: FILE_START size: %.2lfB\n", 
00013                         lp->id, state->type, get_tod(tw_now(lp)), (double) size / 8.0);
00014 #endif
00015 
00016         // send event down to TCP
00017         state->file_size = size;
00018         state->stats->s_nstart++;
00019         state->start = tw_now(lp);
00020         rn_event_send(rn_event_new(lp->gid, 0.0, lp, DOWNSTREAM, size/8));
00021 }
00022 
00023 void
00024 num_file_stop(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, tw_lp * lp)
00025 {
00026 #if NUM_VERIFY
00027 if(lp->id == DEBUG_LP)
00028         printf("%lld T%d %s: FILE_STOP\n", lp->id, state->type, get_tod(tw_now(lp)));
00029 #endif
00030 
00031         state->stats->s_nstop++;
00032 
00033         if(g_num_mod < 1 && g_num_nreport_days == 0)
00034                 return;
00035 
00036         // send event down to TCP
00037         rn_event_send(rn_event_new(lp->gid, 0.0, lp, DOWNSTREAM, 0));
00038 }
00039 
00040 /*
00041  * num_file_complete: handler routine for file completions
00042  *
00043  * Files may complete in two ways:
00044  *
00045  *      1. TCP sends an UPSTREAM event with file x-fer size
00046  *      2. TCP sends an UPSTREAM event with file size 0
00047  *              (indicates TCP failure)
00048  *
00049  * Upon completion, if throughput is good, ask for a larger file.
00050  * If throughput is less than desired, but acceptable, ask for
00051  * same size file.  If throughput is not acceptable, ask for
00052  * minimum size file.
00053  */
00054 void
00055 num_file_complete(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00056 {
00057         tw_stime         elapsed;
00058         tw_stime         ts, tn;
00059 
00060         num_profile     *np;
00061 
00062         int              actual;
00063         int              timeofday;
00064 
00065 #if NUM_VERIFY
00066         if(lp->id == DEBUG_LP)
00067                 printf("%lld T%d %s: FILE_COMPLETE\n", lp->id, state->type,
00068                          get_tod(tw_now(lp)));
00069 #endif
00070 
00071         tn = tw_now(lp);
00072         timeofday = (int) tn % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;
00073         elapsed = tn - state->start;
00074 
00075         if(msg->size == 40)
00076         {
00077                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Received TCP ACK!");
00078         } else if (msg->size > 40)
00079         {
00080                 state->stats->s_total_time += elapsed;
00081                 state->stats->s_total_kb += state->file_size;
00082                 state->stats->s_nfiles++;
00083         } else
00084         {
00085                 // try again?
00086                 state->stats->s_nfailures = 3;
00087 
00088                 return;
00089         }
00090 
00091         actual = state->file_size / elapsed;
00092         np = &g_num_profiles[state->type];
00093 
00094 #if NUM_VERIFY
00095         if(lp->id == DEBUG_LP)
00096         {
00097                 printf("%lld T%d %s: actual: %d, desired: %u, size: %.2lfB, elapsed: %.4lf\n",
00098                         lp->id, state->type, get_tod(tw_now(lp)), actual, 
00099                         np->bitrate, (double) state->file_size / 8.0, elapsed);
00100         }
00101 #endif
00102 
00103         // If after quitting time, then do not ask for another file
00104         if(timeofday >= QUIT_TIME)
00105                 return;
00106 
00107         // Both rate and desired are in bits / second
00108         if(actual >= np->bitrate)
00109         {
00110                 // Increase file size if getting more than desired
00111 
00112                 ts = tn + ((state->file_size / np->bitrate) - elapsed);
00113                 if ( ts <= tn )
00114                         ts = tn + 1.0;
00115                 if((int) ts % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS >= QUIT_TIME)
00116                         return;
00117 
00118                 state->file_size *= 2;
00119                 if (state->file_size > MAX_FILE_SIZE)
00120                         state->file_size = MAX_FILE_SIZE;
00121 
00122                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00123         } else if (actual >= np->bitrate / 2.0)
00124         {
00125                 // Ask for another file right away
00126                 state->file_size *= 2;
00127 
00128                 if(state->file_size > MAX_FILE_SIZE)
00129                         state->file_size = MAX_FILE_SIZE;
00130 
00131                 num_file_start(state, bf, state->file_size, lp);
00132         } else if (actual >= np->bitrate / 10.0)
00133         {
00134                 state->stats->s_nfailures = 2;
00135                 // Ask for another file of same size right away
00136                 num_file_start(state, bf, state->file_size, lp);
00137         } else
00138         {
00139                 // rate is less than acceptable, try again in 2 minutes
00140                 // to keep load on network
00141                 // this would be stage 3
00142                 state->stats->s_nfailures = 3;
00143                 state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE;
00144                 ts = tn + TWO_MINUTES;
00145                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00146         }
00147 }
